page.title: 03BICESTER'S ACCESSIBILITY.
page.content: Bicester is situated 16 miles South East of Banbury and 12 miles North East of Oxford. It lies in the Valley of the River Ray between the Chiltern Hills and the Cotswolds TRANSPORT:(RAIL) The town has a rail station on the London to Banbury and Birmingham lines. There are about 12 trains each day and more at weekends.At present a steam train comes through the town every Sunday;the station is used mainly by people commuting to London and Service people. (BUSES) The South Midland bus company operate hourly services to Oxford and services to Banbury, Buckingham,North- ampton and Milton Keynes. (ROADS) Bicester is on the A41 London trunk road,and the A421>A43.Access to the M1 is through Stony Stratford. The M40 extension will shortly be built, skirting the edge of town.
